intro: Nemophila macrocarpa, commonly known as the showy blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland and open areas. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Nemophila macrocarpa is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators.
